title: Palacio de Cortés
description: The Palacio de Cortés is one of the oldest colonial-era buildings in Mexico. Today it houses the Cuauhnáhuac Regional Museum, where visitors can explore the history of Morelos through impressive murals and exhibits.

title: Jardín Borda
description: Jardín Borda is a historic garden and cultural center once used as a retreat by Emperor Maximilian and Empress Carlota. With fountains, lush vegetation, and art exhibits, it’s a peaceful escape in the heart of the city.

title: Cuernavaca Cathedral
description: The Cuernavaca Cathedral is part of a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the oldest cathedrals in Mexico. Its unique architecture and frescoes make it a must-visit landmark for history and culture lovers.
